title: Open contract proposal response
description: Latest price and other details for an open contract in the user's portfolio

proposal_open_contract.title: Open contract response
proposal_open_contract.description: Latest price and other details for an open contract

high_barrier.description: High barrier of the contract (if any). Example: 42.123

low_barrier.description: Low barrier of the contract (if any). Example: 40.132

barrier.description: Barrier of the contract (if any). Example: 42.123

original_high_barrier.description: Original high barrier of the contract (if any corporate action). Example: 83.246

original_low_barrier.description: Original low barrier of the contract (if any corporate action). Example: 80.262

original_barrier.description: Original barrier of the contract (if any corporate action). Example: 83.246

barrier_count.description: The number of barriers a contract has. Example: 2

bid_price.description: Price at which the contract could be sold back to Binary.com. Example: 5.14

contract_type.description: Contract type, for example CALL, PUT

current_spot.description: Spot value if we have license to stream this symbol. Example: 9874.52

date_expiry.description: Expiry date (epoch) of the Contract. Example: 1446629000. Please note that it is not applicable for spreads and tick trade contracts.

date_settlement.description: Settlement date (epoch) of the contract. Example: 1446629000

date_start.description: Start date (epoch) of the contract. Example: 1446629000

id.description: A stream id that can be used to cancel this stream using the Forget request. Example: 1d6651e7d599bce6c54bd71a8283e579

has_corporate_actions.description: Whether the contract has an applicable corporate actions or not. Boolean value 1 or 0

is_expired.description: Whether the contract is expired or not. Boolean value 1 or 0

is_forward_starting.description: Whether the contract is forward-starting or not. Boolean value 1 or 0

is_intraday.description: Whether the contract is an intraday contract. Boolean value 1 or 0

is_path_dependent.description: Whether the contract expiry price will depend on the path of the market (e.g. One Touch contract). Boolean value 1 or 0

is_valid_to_sell.description: Whether the contract can be sold back to Binary.com. Boolean value 1 or 0

longcode.description: Text description of the contract purchased, Example: Win payout if Volatility 100 Index is strictly higher than entry spot at 10 minutes after contract start time.

payout.description: Payout value of the contract. Example: 10.50

shortcode.description: Coded description of the contract purchased, Example: CALL_R_100_90_1446704187_1446704787_S0P_0

display_value.description: Example: 5.14, same as ask_price except for spread contracts

entry_tick.description: This is the entry spot of the contract. For contracts starting immediately it is the next tick after the start time. For forward-starting contracts it is the spot at the start time. Example: 86.630.

entry_tick_time.description: This is the epoch time of the entry tick. Example: 1446629000

exit_tick.description: This is the latest spot value at the end time of the contract. Example: 86.810

exit_tick_time.description: This is the epoch time of the exit tick. Note that since certain instruments don't tick every second, the exit tick time may be a few seconds before the end time. Example: 1446629000

tick_count.description: Only for tick trades, number of ticks

sell_price.description: Price at which contract was sold, only available when contract has been sold.

buy_price.description: Price at which contract was purchased

purchase_time.description: Epoch of purchase time, will be same as date_start for all contracts except forward starting contracts.

sell_time.description: Epoch time of when the contract was sold (only present for contracts already sold)

sell_spot.description: Latest spot value at the sell time. Example: 86.630 (only present for contracts already sold)

sell_spot_time.description: Epoch time of the sell spot. Note that since certain underlyings don't tick every second, the sell spot time may be a few seconds before the sell time. Example: 1446629000 (only present for contracts already sold)

transaction_ids.title: Transaction ids for contract
transaction_ids.description: Every contract has buy and sell transaction ids, i.e. when you purchase a contract we associate it with buy transaction id, and if contract is already sold we associate that with sell transaction id.

buy.description: Buy transaction id for that contract

sell.description: Sell transaction id for that contract, only present when contract is already sold.

req_id.description: Optional field send in request to map to response, present only when request contains req_id
